website_summaries.verdict: Choose this well-made sander if you prefer a portable model. The low price is also appealing.
pros: Features a portable design that makes it a versatile tool
Compact size with a durable build
650-watt motor is capable of tackling small to mid-level projects
cons: Surprisingly loud for a compact model, so plan on investing in earplugs

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Portability is Awesome, especially if space is limited. Mounting to work bench was easy and greatly appreciated. Sand here, sand there, sand everywhere. Does what I bought it for, Spindle Sander. Faster sanding in confined hard to reach areas than a Dremal type tool. In addition, when using a Dremal (I know the spelling), those little drum sleeves kept popping off after tightening the drum holder. Don't get me wrong, a Dremel is the best tool I own and use. Need more companies to make 3 inch long sanding spindle sleeves, A must, to get 5 stars. Loud, who cares? No reviews, No problem, that's why I have "Prime", which is also awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe Jr

customer_reviews.title: holy crap this thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: A portable oscillating spindle sander? I had no idea that existed. Now I have one that can be stored in a drawer instead of an entire shelf or dedicated corner of a workbench. Awesome! Got it today and gave it a test drive. It's great a small tool for the price and perfect for the hobbyist woodworker like myself.
customer_reviews.author: W. Prince

customer_reviews.title: I’m happy
customer_reviews.text: I’m really glad I bought this as it is really useful for when a piece is too big for a bench type oscillating sander. Lately I’ve had 2 very curvy projects with large components and I’m very happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Cool little sander to work on pieces I cannot get onto my sanding station. Used on some trellis beams with a cove cut to smooth the edges. Beams were too long to get onto my small sander. Could have used a belt sander, but this sander gave more control. It seems fairly well built and functions just fine. I just wish the vertical oscillation was a bit longer of a stroke, but happy overall.
customer_reviews.author: H. Do

customer_reviews.title: This does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This little sander seems to operate very well. Does the job. It is does not have the power of a table version oscillating sander but it will perform just fie on the edge sanding needs in my shop. This is a handy addition to my tools and will be well used while making large curved table tops which are too heavy to manipulate any other way.
customer_reviews.author: Ewox

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool, compact, will get to places hard to reach, nice price, good to have, the sanding rolls are 3" inch (76 mm) tall. My only complain is it has a rather short electric cable so you might want to add an extention.
customer_reviews.author: OrenWood

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money and works as intended. It's a little bit bigger than I thought it would be and quite heavy for its size. However I'm pleased with it's performance and flexibility with the range of different diameter drums.
customer_reviews.author: BritBrat

customer_reviews.title: May not be necessary if you have a table top spindle sander
customer_reviews.text: it's really pretty heavy, I had wanted it as an alternative to my tabletop [Rigid] spindle sander. The projects that I have used on could have been done on the stationary spindle sander
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good sander so far. Have only used it once. I mounted it under a bench and used the hooks it came with. Time will tell.

customer_reviews.title: Super Noisy!!
customer_reviews.text: This sanding tool is rediculously noisy. No reason why a tool that only spins and occilates has to be so loud. I have to wear ear protection when I turn it on.

customer_reviews.title: Hardware not correct
customer_reviews.text: The tapped holes in the base plate for mounting the edge guide are not correct. Screws slip through. Have to use different hardware with nuts underneath. Poor design and manufacture. Sander works as intended but suspect endurance will be an issue.

Includes 1/2", 3/4", 1", 1-1/2" sanding sleeves, rubber pad, and clamps for table mounting

Adjustable edge guide for accurate stock removal
